intro: Geranium intermedium, commonly known as the common geranium, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and heart-shaped, lobed leaves. The plant produces clusters of vibrant pink to red flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for garden borders and rock gardens. Geranium intermedium is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
